schema.description: Create a Expo Component for Nx.

examples.description: Generate a component in the mylib library
Generate a class component in the mylib library

project.x-deprecated: Provide the `directory` option instead and use the `as-provided` format. The project will be determined from the directory provided. It will be removed in Nx v19.

name.x-prompt: What name would you like to use for the component?

js.description: Generate JavaScript files rather than TypeScript files.

skipTests.description: When true, does not create "spec.ts" test files for the new component.

directory.description: The directory at which to create the component file. When `--nameAndDirectoryFormat=as-provided`, it will be relative to the current working directory. Otherwise, it will be relative to the project root.

nameAndDirectoryFormat.description: Whether to generate the component in the directory as provided, relative to the current working directory and ignoring the project (`as-provided`) or generate it using the project and directory relative to the workspace root (`derived`).

flat.description: Create component at the source root rather than its own directory.
flat.x-deprecated: Provide the `directory` option instead and use the `as-provided` format. This option will be removed in Nx v19.

export.description: When true, the component is exported from the project index.ts (if it exists).
export.x-prompt: Should this component be exported in the project?

pascalCaseFiles.description: Use pascal case component file name (e.g. App.tsx).
pascalCaseFiles.x-deprecated: Provide the `name` in pascal-case and use the `as-provided` format. This option will be removed in Nx v19.

classComponent.description: Use class components instead of functional component.
